messages.content:
display this markdown table:

| What is your motivation to join the program? | Hi, i am a Lebanese women who worked very hard to achieve all her dreams.
I work in an insurance company and with the help of a friend we created a Lebanese organic skincare product that aim to help, support and empower women's in need, I am working hard to make jouri a well recognized skincare Lebanese brand and i need help from programs to achieve my dream of empowering women's, educating the community on the importance of organic products and promoting suitable beauty eco friendly products |
|-|-|

| Gender | Female |

| Geographic Location | REGION - MENA |
| Age | 25-29 |
| Nationality  | Lebanon |
| Phone number | 96176653852 |
| Social Media Links | https://www.instagram.com/jouri.co/ |
| Describe your company in 120 characters | Jouri Cosmetics, a Lebanese brand, brings you the finest natural and organic skincare and beauty products. |
| Sectors | Health Care; General / Other |
| Entreprise stage pre-funding | 3.2. Have a functioning (high-fidelity) prototype with early users / early adopters) |

| Current Team Size | 3 |
| Team Roles and Background | Toufic Kassem - Founder- Chemical engineer
Yasmine Samhoun - co founder- Managing director- masters n risk management
Nancy daoud- employee |
| Founding Date (31/12/2022) MM/DD/YYYY | 6/18/2021 |

| Registration Status of The Company | registered as a Lebanese entity |
| Type of Company | Self-employed/Entrepreneur |
| Registration country | Lebanon |
| Website |  |
| Team growth plans: What are your current plans to grow the business? | Raising awareness |

| State the (green) problem you are solving and how you first identified it | Reducing the overall environmental impact associated with chemicals skincare production. This may include minimizing pesticide and chemical use, promoting eco-friendly packaging, and implementing responsible manufacturing processes.
Prioritize the use of natural and non-toxic ingredients, potentially reducing the exposure to harmful chemicals for consumers. |
| Your solution / value proposition: What is the Company offering? | Jouri aims to improve human’s lives by offering safe and natural skincare products. Reducing the risk of skin irritation, allergies, and long-term health effects associated with chemicals skincare products. |
| Traction: Your monthly sales or monthly active users/or clients | we offer our products on ishtari platform, shop in gemmayze and through direct sales on instagram.
Monthly sales is almost 500 USD |
| SDG Focus | SDG GOAL 3: Good Health and Well-being |

| Impact and key impact indicators: How do you measure success beyond financial revenues? What kind of impact have you already had? | Jouri goes beyond providing natural and organic products. It takes an active role in promoting the well-being of its consumers, minimizing its environmental impact, supporting social causes, and promoting transparency, Jouri contribute to a more sustainable and socially conscious beauty industry, allowing consumers to care for their skin while also caring for the planet and the communities around them.
Furthermore, Jouri empower consumers to make informed choices and understand the benefits of using organic skincare products not only for themselves but also for the environment. |
| Investment or Funding Raised | none |
| Priorities Areas of Development | Revenues, Financial Management & Sustainability |
| Elaborate on your priority areas of development (max 250 words) | Social outcomes:
1. Reducing the overall environmental impact associated with chemicals skincare production. This may include minimizing pesticide and chemical use, promoting eco-friendly packaging, and implementing responsible manufacturing processes.
2. Prioritize the use of natural and non-toxic ingredients, potentially reducing the exposure to harmful chemicals for consumers.
3. Invest in consumer education initiatives to raise awareness about the benefits of organic and natural skincare. This can include providing information about ingredients, product usage..
We are working on reaching as much as we can and as planned by 3 years we will be able to reach 70-80% of the Lebanese population and working also in reaching worldwide |
| Link to 2 min pitch video (Please use loom.com or another tool to record a short 2 min introduction video about your team and your company) |  |
| Have you participated in any other accelerator or mentorship programs before? If yes, please provide details. | NA |

Certainly! Here's the Markdown table you provided:

```markdown
| What is your motivation to join the program? | Hi, I am a Lebanese woman who worked very hard to achieve all her dreams.
I work in an insurance company and with the help of a friend, we created a Lebanese organic skincare product that aims to help, support, and empower women in need. I am working hard to make Jouri a well-recognized skincare Lebanese brand and I need help from programs to achieve my dream of empowering women, educating the community on the importance of organic products, and promoting suitable eco-friendly beauty products. |
|-|-|

| Gender | Female |

| Geographic Location | REGION - MENA |
| Age | 25-29 |
| Nationality | Lebanon |
| Phone Number | 96176653852 |
| Social Media Links | [https://www.instagram.com/jouri.co/](https://www.instagram.com/jouri.co/) |
| Describe Your Company in 120 Characters | Jouri Cosmetics, a Lebanese brand, brings you the finest natural and organic skincare and beauty products. |
| Sectors | Health Care; General / Other |
| Enterprise Stage Pre-funding | 3.2. Have a functioning (high-fidelity) prototype with early users / early adopters) |

| Current Team Size | 3 |
| Team Roles and Background | Toufic Kassem - Founder - Chemical engineer
Yasmine Samhoun - Co-founder - Managing director - master's in risk management
Nancy Daoud - Employee |
| Founding Date (31/12/2022) MM/DD/YYYY | 6/18/2021 |

| Registration Status of The Company | Registered as a Lebanese entity |
| Type of Company | Self-employed/Entrepreneur |
| Registration Country | Lebanon |
| Website | |
| Team Growth Plans: What Are Your Current Plans to Grow the Business? | Raising awareness |

| State the (Green) Problem You Are Solving and How You First Identified It | Reducing the overall environmental impact associated with chemical skincare production. This may include minimizing pesticide and chemical use, promoting eco-friendly packaging, and implementing responsible manufacturing processes.
Prioritize the use of natural and non-toxic ingredients, potentially reducing consumers' exposure to harmful chemicals. |
| Your Solution / Value Proposition: What is the Company Offering? | Jouri aims to improve human lives by offering safe and natural skincare products. Reducing the risk of skin irritation, allergies, and long-term health effects associated with chemical skincare products. |
| Traction: Your Monthly Sales or Monthly Active Users/Clients | We offer our products on the Ishtari platform, a shop in Gemmayze, and through direct sales on Instagram.
Monthly sales are almost 500 USD |
| SDG Focus | SDG GOAL 3: Good Health and Well-being |

| Impact and Key Impact Indicators: How Do You Measure Success Beyond Financial Revenues? What Kind of Impact Have You Already Had? | Jouri goes beyond providing natural and organic products. It takes an active role in promoting the well-being of its consumers, minimizing its environmental impact, supporting social causes, and promoting transparency. Jouri contributes to a more sustainable and socially conscious beauty industry, allowing consumers to care for their skin while also caring for the planet and the communities around them.
Furthermore, Jouri empowers consumers to make informed choices and understand the benefits of using organic skincare products, not only for themselves but also for the environment. |
| Investment or Funding Raised | None |
| Priorities Areas of Development | Revenues, Financial Management & Sustainability |
| Elaborate on Your Priority Areas of Development (Max 250 Words) | Social outcomes:
1. Reducing the overall environmental impact associated with chemical skincare production. This may include minimizing pesticide and chemical use, promoting eco-friendly packaging, and implementing responsible manufacturing processes.
2. Prioritize the use of natural and non-toxic ingredients, potentially reducing consumers' exposure to harmful chemicals.
3. Invest in consumer education initiatives to raise awareness about the benefits of organic and natural skincare. This can include providing information about ingredients, product usage.
We are working on reaching as much as we can and as planned by 3 years, we will be able to reach 70-80% of the Lebanese population and working also on reaching worldwide |
| Link to 2 Min Pitch Video (Please Use loom.com or Another Tool to Record a Short 2 Min Introduction Video about Your Team and Your Company) | |
| Have You Participated in Any Other Accelerator or Mentorship Programs Before? If Yes, Please Provide Details. | NA |
```

give me this same table as markdown except the
s should be line breaks table: question answer What is your motivation to join the program? I want to learn how to come up with a business strategy for my business. Can i predict where my business will in 5 years to come. That is my driving niche to join the program. Gender Female Geographic Location REGION - Sub-Saharan Africa Age 40+ Nationality Kenya Phone number +254 726402341 Social Media Links Kenya Describe your company in 120 characters N/A Sectors N/A Entreprise stage pre-funding Tombo Agri-Con Agencies is a women led enterprise that puts a smile on many women faces. We produce honey and also value chain, after the honey we produce body cream from bee wax, soap and candles. The dead bees during harvesting are fed to our poultry which we sale and get money. Current Team Size Agriculture; General / Other Team Roles and Background 3.2. Have a functioning (high-fidelity) prototype with early users / early adopters) Founding Date (31/12/2022) MM/DD/YYYY 7 Registration Status of The Company Mildred - Background in business administration and management and a bit of finance
Lydiah - Marketing and development of marketing materials
Anne- Human Resource
Rabbeca - Wast management and policy Type of Company Self-employed/Entrepreneur Registration country Limited Company Website 2/19/2018 Team growth plans: What are your current plans to grow the business? Currently we have 20 bee hives which each minimum produces 30kgs and one kg sells at Ksh.600. Tom Agri-Con Agencies is a women focused and steered enterprise making sure women can strive on their own without depending on someone and earn a living in a humble women. We are building resilient women, where by the end of the year we will have 50 bee hives and every woman will be having at least 5 bee hives at her homestead. State the (green) problem you are solving and how you first identified it Food insecurity through bee keeping, bees act as agents of pollination, thus increase in food production, health benefits from the honey and innovation of other products through value addition. As an enterprise we believe that women have indigenous knowledge, and understand the challenges facing them. Through community conversations and dialogues, Tombo Agri-Con Agencies created a platform giving a center stage to all the women to share the challenges through which they identify the solutions to these challenges and prioritize which challenge has to be address first and through which solutions. This is because since memorial women are the corner stone of a family/home yet they are the most affected with issues of climate change, floods, drought, gender based violence, fire out breaks, denied rights to education and even rights to own a property. It is from this back stop that Tombo Agri Con Agencies evolved, to make women self-dependent, earn income to sustain their basic need and live a better life Your solution / value proposition: What is the Company offering? Through Tombo Agri-Con Agencies, women have been able to start small groceries, kiosks, saloons. Every woman has at least one or two bee hives which gives a minimum of 30kg of honey. There is knowledge transfer from the women to the youth within their homestead and neighborhoods. Traction: Your monthly sales or monthly active users/or clients Our products are sold locally and across the board (Uganda). In a good season we can do Ksh. 500,000.00 SDG Focus SDG GOAL 1: No Poverty Impact and key impact indicators: How do you measure success beyond financial revenues? What kind of impact have you already had? Yes there has been tremendous change in the lives of many women and the community at large. The women have socially, economically and politically empowered. The have a voice can sit at a table and contribute to decision making. They can take they children to school, pay their medical bills and even purchase a property. Some women have become TOTs can train other women on apiculture and they are embracing environmental conservation by planting indigenous where the bee hives are kept. Investment or Funding Raised Our funds comes from our sells and we reinvest. Priorities Areas of Development Revenues, Financial Management & Sustainability Elaborate on your priority areas of development (max 250 words) As much as we have been in business for some good time, there is more that need to be strengthened on revenue generation, how do we manage our business to remain competitive and relevant to the business environment and for longevity Link to 2 min pitch video (Please use loom.com or another tool to record a short 2 min introduction video about your team and your company) https://web.facebook.com/tom agricon/videos/3088063797875267 Have you participated in any other accelerator or mentorship programs before? If yes, please provide details. No

can you do the same for this data:
"Our motivation to participate in the progarm is that we are currently in a rut and are currently looking for mentorship and advise to accelerate our social enterprise to the next level. We know that we have a strong foundation but lack the knowledge on how to proceed. We are looking to expand the GrowBox brand nationally and even internationally. We hope that by being part of this program we would reach our impact goals of reaching 20 000 people in the next 5 years. , Female, REGION - Sub-Saharan Africa, 40+, REGION - Sub-Saharan Africa, 0761475274, 6/16/2016, Registration No: 2016/235676/07
Vendor for City of Cape Town 
Government CSD vendor, Private Sector, REGION - Sub-Saharan Africa, www.growboxnursery.co.za, Facebook: @growboxnursery
Instagram: @growbox_nursery
, Agriculture; General / Other, 4.2. Revenues are stagnant or growing slowly, but the enterprise is not however profitable/sustainable, 3 including myself, Renshia Manuel - Founder Owner
Ju-daine Leibrandt - Plant Production Manager
Zea Abrahams - Training Facilitator , We strengthen access to food sovereignty with the skills, resources and support for organic, sustainable food gardens.
, GrowBox is currently established as a PTY Ltd but our growth strategy is that we want to transition into a hybrid social enterprise model of having a PTY and NPC. This way it would be easier for corporations to fund social impact projects and get tax rebates through the NPC which will do training and urban agricultural/greening projects and have a for-profit model on the business end for our products range that could be shipped nationally and internationally. , We work in the most vulnerable communities. Those in which poverty and unemployment are rife and often where social ills like gangsterism, and substance and drug abuse are considered a norm. Poverty and hunger within urban settlements triple every year but with minimal access to land, especially within informal settlements, it's quite hard for households to sustainably feed themselves daily. Within the South African context, 45.2% of South African households solely depend on government social grants but the grant allocation is not enough to feed a family (of a minimum 4) for an entire month. With unemployment and child-headed households on the rise, it’s imperative that we focus on urban agriculture within poverty-stricken settlements to curb hunger, food security and poverty. , One of our social impact pillars is that GrowBox facilitates food gardening workshops (with the support of corporates, government entities and NGOs) and the necessary skills to teach sustainable food gardening. We also concentrate on an eco-friendly and holistic approach to food gardening with an emphasis on soil nutrition, composting, seed harvesting, recycling and agri-business opportunities from subsistence farming. We also provide the beneficiaries with gardening starter kits and ongoing support. 

As a social enterprise, we strive to strengthen marginalized communities' access to food sovereignty by providing them with the necessary skills, resources and support for organic, sustainable & nutritious food gardens.
We do this through our various impact pillars:
1. Wholesale seedling nursery & manufacture and supply wooden veggie gardens ( these are supplied fully stocked with the grow medium and seedlings in a hassle-free veggie garden, available in 5 garden varieties )etc, salad, stir fry, herb gardens)
2. Facilitate food gardening workshops
3. Urban farm for practical training and farming
4. Support communities with food gardens with our corporate & government partners

, The monthly sale on average is 2000 USD. 
Our clients are:
B2B - Supplying seedlings wholesale to retail nurseries, farmers and corporate clients 
B2B - supplying fresh organic produce to retail grocers. (urban farm) 
B2B - supplying landscaping plants to landscaping companies.
B2B- corporate social responsibility funds contribute to social impact training courses and gardening inputs for beneficiaries
B2C - supplying seedlings, food-scaping services and wooden veggie gardens 
B2G - supplying seedlings, wooden veggie gardens and training courses & gardening inputs for beneficiaries. 

, SDG GOAL 2: Zero Hunger, To date we have impacted 
5834 beneficiaries (of which 80% is women) of food gardening workshops
26 gardens were established in poverty-stricken areas.
11320 veggie boxes distributed (with food gardening training.) 
6135 learners (of which 3740 are girls) in primary & high schools 
It’s our goal to impact 20 000 beneficiaries in the next 5 years and we are confident that we can reach these targets with the help of HERMeNow and getting the support and mentorship to impact more households.
, 5 000USD since 2016, Strategy, We are not sure if our planned strategy is the right move and therefore need expert advice and mentorship, Redbull Amaphiko in 2017 , https://youtu.be/QDxwwOPNOU4"

We also concentrate on an eco-friendly and holistic approach to food gardening with an emphasis on soil nutrition, composting, seed harvesting, recycling and agri-business opportunities from subsistence farming. We also provide the beneficiaries with gardening starter kits and ongoing support. 

As a social enterprise, we strive to strengthen marginalized communities' access to food sovereignty by providing them with the necessary skills, resources and support for organic, sustainable & nutritious food gardens.

3. Urban farm for practical training and farming
4. Support communities with food gardens with our corporate & government partners
